{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3378841,"name":"Drew Williams","username":"jreneew2","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jreneew2/{size}/135239_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T16:59:05.316Z","cooked":"

Hello CD,

I noticed a couple teams running the new Vex Grip Lock Wheels this season and was wondering how teams liked them.

Some initial questions I have included:

  • How long did they last / how often did you replace them?
  • Because they are so squishy, did you find your Odometry accuracy to be effected? Did your Odometry change as the wheels wore down?
  • How did they compare to the standard treaded wheels or custom 3d printed wheels?
  • did you notice or take any data comparing breaking traction between different wheel types?

Thanks!

Drew

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T16:59:05.316Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":627,"reads":1278,"readers_count":1277,"score":3465.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":465157,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions","display_username":"Drew Williams","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/vexpro-new-products-2024-2025/477293/10","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"VEXpro New Products 2024-2025","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21777,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":" I moved to California just for districts"},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions/465157/1","custom_user_title":" I moved to California just for districts","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3378844,"name":"Joey R","username":"jlr","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jlr/{size}/208524_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T17:02:33.098Z","cooked":"

We personally didn’t find them that great, we ran them for about 10 hours and then at PNW DCMP at which they lasted 8 or so matches before noticeable degradation. Our odometry was significantly more accurate compared to black nitrile and we didn’t notice any changes in odometer accuracy after the wheels wore in a bit, but our average auto accuracy did not improve significantly after switching to grip locks. While they had noticeably more tractive force, the wheels caused the robot to bounce under sudden momentum changes which made the robot significantly less maneuverable.

Hope this helps!

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T17:02:33.098Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":1241,"readers_count":1240,"score":368.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":465157,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions","display_username":"Joey R","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53914,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"hired (yay!)"},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions/465157/2","custom_user_title":"hired (yay!)","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3378994,"name":"sanddrag","username":"sanddrag","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/c68b51/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T19:39:34.115Z","cooked":"

We too experienced bouncing in testing during the season, and immediately switched back to nitrile.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T19:39:34.115Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":1146,"readers_count":1145,"score":289.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":465157,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions","display_username":"sanddrag","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1082,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions/465157/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3378996,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T19:42:02.041Z","cooked":"

Ran them at Worlds. Version 1 has a weird hopping/spring resetting behavior; we had one of them on the robot (accidentally) . Version 2 just works. Didn’t have to think about it after getting all V2 on the bot.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T19:42:02.041Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":1130,"readers_count":1129,"score":321.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":465157,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions/465157/4","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379017,"name":"Ryan Stockton","username":"rstockton429","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rstockton429/{size}/179783_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T19:57:47.420Z","cooked":"

The Robonauts ran Grip Lock V2 wheels the entire season. In our testing the V1 wheels were nowhere near durable enough for us to feel comfortable running them on a full weight robot in competition (we use them on light weight driver training robots.) The V2 wheels however performed great and in 114 official matches and many more practice matches we never saw any durability issues.

We replaced them every event for most of the season. Early season we ran 2 events + practice on one set and replaced them only because it seemed like we should, not because we noticed a decrease in performance*.

In our testing the Grip Lock V2 wheels have the best combination of traction and durability of all the treads we tested including blue nitrile tread, black neoprene, 3D printed TPU tires of various designs, and Dr. Joe Johnson’s printed tires. Spectrum has good test data in their Open Alliance thread on wheel tread testing that generally agrees with the test data we collected.

*Our autonomous modes didn’t rely on odometry since they used Apriltag tracking for scoring and note detection for picking up game pieces so this year we weren’t affected by wheel wear causing odometry errors in auton.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T19:58:11.923Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":36,"reads":1100,"readers_count":1099,"score":700.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":465157,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions","display_username":"Ryan Stockton","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/spectrum-3847-build-blog-2024/447471/217","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Spectrum 3847 | Build Blog 2024","clicks":91}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":18}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26026,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Everybot | Robonauts 118 | NASA RAP"},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions/465157/5","custom_user_title":"Everybot | Robonauts 118 | NASA RAP","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":17},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":18,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379030,"name":"Amicus1","username":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T20:09:08.950Z","cooked":"

We tried them at our third event and experienced the bouncing throwing off maneuverability in teleop.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T20:09:08.950Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":1009,"readers_count":1008,"score":271.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":465157,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions","display_username":"Amicus1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53914,"username":"jlr","name":"Joey R","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jlr/{size}/208524_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue"},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions/465157/6","custom_user_title":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379081,"name":"Doug Kavner","username":"dkavner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dkavner/{size}/207188_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T21:18:07.966Z","cooked":"

We ran V2s this season at 3 regionals and Worlds. We replaced them before each event and whenever they started to crack. We had one or two wheels start to develop cracks during each event. They increased our top speed by 15% over black nitrile. We observed slippage of the leading wheel(s) in auto using AdvantageScope, which was affecting our odometry. We considered modifying our odometry updates to filter out the wheel slippage, but our students didn’t have time to develop this algorithm and the associated code, so we settled for reducing our acceleration. Our driver didn’t report any issue with bouncing. We intend to do in-depth comparisons with black nitrile and possibly Colsons during the off-season.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T21:18:07.966Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":984,"readers_count":983,"score":241.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":465157,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions","display_username":"Doug Kavner","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54568,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions/465157/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379089,"name":"John Fogarty","username":"JohnFogarty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnfogarty/{size}/267052_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T21:25:55.397Z","cooked":"

V1 wheels cause bouncing issues which means they aren’t even useful for practice.

V2 wheels seem to be pretty good, but I wonder if they are really worth it unless your robot is pretty light.

We had problems with screws backing out of 2 of our hubs early in the season and had to find a solution that did not involve locktite. Since the hub is plastic this screw back out problem basically destroyed the hubs so we had to order an extra set to replace the damaged hub. I emailed vex but got no reply. I suppose the hub damage is mostly a skill issue and not thinking to apply some kind of glue compound to the screw end.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T21:25:55.397Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":936,"readers_count":935,"score":227.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":465157,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions","display_username":"John Fogarty","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12688,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions/465157/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379096,"name":"Ravi Ponmalai","username":"rponmalai","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rponmalai/{size}/216860_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T21:33:41.351Z","cooked":"

Could you clarify what you mean, how did they increase your top speed? Do they have a larger diameter then the wheels you used before?

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T21:33:41.351Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":899,"readers_count":898,"score":244.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":465157,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions","display_username":"Ravi Ponmalai","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":54568,"username":"dkavner","name":"Doug Kavner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dkavner/{size}/207188_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18172,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions/465157/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379097,"name":"Ryan Stockton","username":"rstockton429","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rstockton429/{size}/179783_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T21:36:47.544Z","cooked":"

Vibra-Tite is our preferred thread locker for use on plastics. We used this all season on the Grip Lock hubs with no bolts backing out.

It does require you to apply it to the bolts 10-30 mins before install but does have a benefit of not having to be re-applied for up to 5 installs.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T21:36:47.544Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":892,"readers_count":891,"score":308.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":465157,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions","display_username":"Ryan Stockton","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.mcmaster.com/75145A69/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"McMaster-Carr","clicks":132},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/perils-of-loctite-on-polycarbonate/474706/8","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Perils of Loctite on polycarbonate","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12688,"username":"JohnFogarty","name":"John Fogarty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnfogarty/{size}/267052_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26026,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Everybot | Robonauts 118 | NASA RAP"},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions/465157/10","custom_user_title":"Everybot | Robonauts 118 | NASA RAP","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379109,"name":"Doug Kavner","username":"dkavner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dkavner/{size}/207188_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T21:56:03.214Z","cooked":"

The size of the wheels was the same. The difference must have been due to the increased traction of the Grip Lock Wheels. We plan to investigate this further in our off-season testing now that we have access to all of the applicable data through AdvantageScope.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T21:56:03.214Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":865,"readers_count":864,"score":173.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":465157,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions","display_username":"Doug Kavner","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":18172,"username":"rponmalai","name":"Ravi Ponmalai","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rponmalai/{size}/216860_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54568,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions/465157/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379123,"name":"Ethan Reed","username":"Ethan_Reed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ethan_reed/{size}/179877_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T22:22:05.263Z","cooked":"

While I’d echo everything Ryan has already shared about how good they’ve been for 118, I’ll also add on my own thoughts since I’m a huge believer in these wheels.

The wear life is incredible. We likely didn’t need to replace them nearly as often as we did, it’s just that we stocked up expecting them to become unavailable pretty quickly, and swapped out of an abundance of caution. We’ve held onto our used wheels and will probably swap them back in once we’ve exhausted our supply. On a full weight robot with a CG lower than ~8", Kraken SDS L2, these last upwards of 30 matches before they’re visibly worn enough that I would expect a decrease in performance. Easily a whole event; though two events may be pushing it.

Traction performance was very good. Spectrum’s testing (linked above) varied a little from our COF testing, but did show similar trends. I think there is a directionality and dependence on robot CG that comes into play. The flexibility and spoke geometry tend to allow the wheel to start to fold over (though not to a concerning extent), potentially causing a better “dig in” when they’re loaded laterally, NOT in the direction you are using them to apply a traction to the ground during acceleration. We found slightly lower values overall for COF than 3847 did, with their low CG robot and “x-wheels” pattern. Our testing was with the wheels locked out but all facing straight forward. Grip Lock wheels yielded the highest static COF in our testing on a tilt platform with our 2023 robot (essentially full weight and CG at 10" from the floor). Joe Johnson’s SLS wheels performed almost identically, but only lasted about 60 seconds of normal driving before a significant drop off in performance. We also tested a dynamic COF by slipping wheels while pushing against a scale balanced against a wall and found the best performance from Grip Locks.

We did a little testing on last year’s Charge Station as well, and found that the lack of slippery/intermittent button head bolts helped maintain a more consistent traction, though I don’t have a good sense as to whether they have higher COF values than black neoprene tread on polycarbonate surfaces or not. With new field carpet on the horizon, I’ll be interested to see if any of our conclusions change. I think there’s some magic to the pitch of the tread mirroring the weave spacing of the current carpet.

As the list of excellent options for COTS swerve modules grows, I’d love to see these wheels made in different sizes. Currently, Grip Locks are good enough that I wouldn’t consider using a module that cannot accommodate 4" Grip Lock wheels.

There’s my Grip Lock Appreciation Post… @bkahl and crew did a great job on these, and I hope they’re able to keep up this momentum.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T22:26:08.238Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":864,"readers_count":863,"score":547.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":465157,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions","display_username":"Ethan Reed","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":18}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31183,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"118 Drive Coach & Everybot"},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions/465157/12","custom_user_title":"118 Drive Coach & Everybot","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":18}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":18,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379127,"name":"Doug Kavner","username":"dkavner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dkavner/{size}/207188_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T22:24:10.796Z","cooked":"
rponmalai:

Do they have a larger diameter then the wheels you used before?

Actually, I just remembered that our billet wheels with black nitrile were slightly under 4", which I had always found odd, especially since the grip lock wheels are exactly 4". Our git history shows that the previous diameter was 3.9", so that means the grip lock wheels have an advantage of 2.56% in top speed with all else being equal. Our gear ratio is 5.90278, although that is something that we also plan to experiment with.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2024-05-02T22:27:20.641Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":793,"readers_count":792,"score":188.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":465157,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions","display_username":"Doug Kavner","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54568,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions/465157/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379129,"name":"Ryan Dognaux","username":"Ryan_Dognaux","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_dognaux/{size}/129138_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-02T22:29:18.019Z","cooked":"

5010 observed bouncing when making sudden directional changes at high speeds as well even with the v2 wheel. We didn’t have a lot of time to troubleshoot and ended up rolling back to black neoprene billet which resolved the issue. Not sure why some teams see this bouncing effect and others don’t, but we’d like to give them a shot again this off-season.

Measuring the OD isnt going to tell you the correct inches per rev for odometry. Those fingers reach into the carpet, so the effective rolling surface is in a bit.

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2024-05-03T00:34:58.519Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":745,"readers_count":744,"score":149.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":465157,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions/465157/15","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379224,"name":"Cameron (Advanced Programmer)","username":"Juniormunk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/juniormunk/{size}/126866_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-03T00:52:41.591Z","cooked":"

We swapped from colsons to grip pock wheels right before worlds and noticed two things… Bouncing, so we made custom hubs to eliminate it, then also shuttering in our autons that appeared right when we switched to grip locks and promptly went away when we switched back to colsons. The shuttering could be a tuning thing and we plan to investigate that. However the wheels provided excellent grip and wear resistant I would love to use them all next season provided we fix our shuttering. I will note the the shuttering was most around curves in our path and not in straight lines.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2024-05-03T00:52:41.591Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":746,"readers_count":745,"score":199.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":465157,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions","display_username":"Cameron (Advanced Programmer)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":35092,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions/465157/16","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379354,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-03T06:27:14.723Z","cooked":"

We ran Colsons early in the season, found them to be super fiddly for auto odometry, and ran griplock for our last two comps. We accepted the griplocks bouncing during teleop, because the auto odometry was much better. We pushed the wear life too far when we ran the same tread for CVR finals, a week of drive practice, and EBR Practice Day - our autos were all bad on day 1 of EBR and got much better on fresh tread at the start of qualifying.

I wouldn’t necessarily recommend them to most teams, they’re way too expensive for the marginal gain over tread and are likely too soft for most mid-weight robots (teleop bounce). I see reports from full weight teams having the greatest success on the griplocks. I plan to push ballast into our architecture to get us closer to full weight, and also plan play with tread solutions on aluminum wheels this offseason to stay underweight…

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2024-05-03T06:27:52.456Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":710,"readers_count":709,"score":212.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":465157,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions/465157/17","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379386,"name":"Andy Nguyen","username":"ShinyShips","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/shinyships/{size}/7535_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-03T10:21:43.430Z","cooked":"

We are full weight and ran grip locks until DCMP and bounced like crazy. Just was not a good look for scouting. But I can say if you end up playing defense they are crazy good. Multiple times when we got a note stuck or some other issue our driver held 2-3 robots back at the source

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2024-05-03T10:21:43.430Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":17,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":693,"readers_count":692,"score":158.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":465157,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions","display_username":"Andy Nguyen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28019,"username":"s-neff","name":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22924,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3314 Strategy Mentor | Operator 2014 - 2016"},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions/465157/18","custom_user_title":"3314 Strategy Mentor | Operator 2014 - 2016","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379402,"name":"Rahul Yarlagadda","username":"Knufire","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/knufire/{size}/67820_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-03T11:39:32.832Z","cooked":"
s-neff:

I see reports from full weight teams having the greatest success

We were full weight as well and saw this bouncing issue. Interestingly enough, I heard the opposite over the season, that lighter robots had better behavior on the wheels.

At the same time, there’s a few teams (118 here, 868 locally) that seem to have gotten them to work very well.

I’m not sure what the critical variable is. It might be CG instead of weight. I’ve also heard it suggested that swerve steering loops may need to be retuned specifically for this wheel to have better behavior.

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":42,"updated_at":"2024-05-03T11:39:32.832Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":17,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":691,"readers_count":690,"score":228.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":465157,"topic_slug":"vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions","display_username":"Rahul Yarlagadda","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7457 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/vex-grip-lock-wheel-impressions/465157/19","custom_user_title":"7457 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3379448,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-03T13:38:13.536Z","cooked":"

One critical bit is V1 vs V2. When you buy, you get 4 of each. Mix them and you get hopping. Go all V2 for competition. V1 should be fine for practice.
